sources.title: The Sand Pebbles (1966)
sources.description: "The Sand Pebbles" is a 1966 American film directed by Robert Wise, based on the novel of the same name by Richard McKenna. It stars Steve McQueen, who plays the role of Jake Holman, a naval engineer serving on a gunboat in 1926 China. The film explores themes of isolation, cultural clash, and the moral dilemmas faced by those in foreign lands. The film follows Holman as he navigates the complexities of life on the Yangtze River, dealing with both the local Chinese population and the conflicts among the crew members of the USS San Pablo. The narrative highlights Holmanâ€™s struggle to find his place amid the turbulent political landscape. The film was nominated for several Academy Awards and won for Best Cinematography, capturing the sweeping visuals of the Chinese landscape.

metadata.Plot: In 1926, a U.S. Naval engineer gets assigned to a gunboat on a rescue mission in war-torn China.
metadata.Actors: Steve McQueen, Richard Attenborough, Richard Crenna
